title: How is Advanced Foundations of ML as an elective? Is the syllabus too much to manage?
content:
https://preview.redd.it/cmjqoexhxu7f1.png?width=945&format=png&auto=webp&s=37f4d266b077be7c6e719f0675c598f6fe946c75

AFML is an elective being offered for 5th sem AIML students. The syllabus seems to be of good use for further courses in ML but seems to be too hefty and crammed. Is it doable?

comments.body:
We had a 5 credit course with a very similar syllabus called Algorithms and Optimizations in Machine Learning AOML

Idk why they made it a 4 credit elective
Which sem was that in and also could you please send the course structure/slides if you have them.

It was in our 5th sem   
[https://limewire.com/d/jcpfZ#DUPtAN9LHX](https://limewire.com/d/jcpfZ#DUPtAN9LHX)  
this lasts one week i guess
